alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 3:21PM EST until March 08 at 4:36PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio... Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry affecting Stark County. For the Nimishillen Creek...including North Industry...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. The crest is expected to occur just above major flood stage of 13.00 feet. * WHERE...Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water inundates the first floor of homes in Canton and North Industry. Central Avenue Southeast floods in Canton Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 PM EST Monday was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.4 feet on 01/13/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 130 AM EST.
